history.text: You should watch the movie Maleficent, it has Angelina Jolie!
I'd like to watch the movie...what is it about?
Its a dark fantasy film and it destroys stereotypes that were only briefly touched on in the movie Frozen
That sounds interesting and I liked the movie Frozen.
It is kind of based on the original sleeping beauty but from the view of Maleficent who is originally portayed as a villian in Sleeping Beauty.
I've always liked the fairy tale movies and Maleficent sounds like it would be a different slant on the movie.
Then this movie sounds like it is up your alley. The backgrounds are very intricate and have been made with bleeding-edge digital design.
Yes, definitely, are there other well known actors in this movie as well?
Elle Fanning plays Aurora.  There is also Imelda Staunton and Juno Temple playing supporting roles.
I've seen Elle Fanning in a few movie roles and that should be a great part for her as Aurora. I'm not familiar with the other two actors though.
I am not sure if you know this but it one of the scenes has Maleficent as a powerful fairy. She falls in love with a human peasant boy who ends up betraying her.
Oh, that sounds interesting but I don't like the outcome of the peasant boy betraying her in the end. Sounds sad.
That part is sad. The film portrays the conflicted relationship with the princess and the king (who used to be the peasant boy).
So the peasant boy becomes the king at the end of the movie and ends up with the princess?
I dont want to spoil the ending for you.  It got a 5.7 score on Rotten Tomatoes.
Oh, that's true. I'll just have to watch the movie myself. So is the 5.7 score out of a 10 score being the best?
Yes, 10 as the best.Do you generally watch movies with (good/bad) ratings?
I usually don't watch movies if they got a bad rating. Or I go by recommendation of family and friends.
That's smart. I am the same way.  Initially Maleficent does not like Aurora but she begins to care for her when the pixies fail to do so.
So it sounds like Maleficent may seem like she's mean at first, but then starts being nice since she takes care of Aurora?
Yes, Maleficent is one of those tough on the outside but has a warm heart.
That's a good contrast in a movie to keep it interesting.

The day before her 16th birthday Aurora tells her she tells Maleficent that she wants her to live with her in the Moors (fairy forest). But when Aurora finds out from the pixies about Maleficents identity she runs to her fathers castle.
I bet Maleficent feels betrayed and angered then when Aurora leaves.
Yes she does. The King ends up locking away Aurora for her safety. Unfortunately the curse draws Aurora to the spinning wheel where she pricks her finger and falls asleep
So it is like Sleeping Beauty who needs to be awakened with a kiss by her Prince or King?
Exactly, just from the perspective of Maleficent but this time Maleficent wants to save Aurora from the curse not harm her.
Oh good, I like happy endings in movies and this one seems like it'll turn out well.
There is true love in the movie just not where you would initally expect
That sounds like I really need to see the outcome in the movie now for myself.
The performances are really great by all of the actors.
I wonder why it didn't get a higher rating than what you said then?
Well Cinema Score gave it an A and Metacritic gave it 56 out of 100. Thats why I think its good you go by friends and familiys opinions.
Oh, okay, so just a matter of opinion on different polls.
Pretty much. Everyone has their own opinion. It is definitely entertaining to watch and the imagery is fantastic.
I guess I'll have to see the movie to see for myself and decide.
Absolutely! Its the side of the story never told before.
Ok, I guess we can end this conversation now?

yes I believe so since we both replied 12x
. Have a swell day!

uid2response.feedback: We were able to chat and discuss the movie very easily.
